Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); two added white bands; exterior: double guilloche in handle zone; below, three narrow bands and a fourth at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the interior decoration and concentric bands on exterior, see British Museum 1924,1201.466.a.
A paper label on the outside reads, probably in pencil, 'List 48'; on the inside pencil '48 list' and '15'.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 405)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0108) (phase 2)
